Description: Part of a foundation-deposit: rectangular copper plaque, so heavily corroded that some grains of sand from where the foundation deposit was found, are held by the corrosion.
Authority: Ruler: Psamtek I (from context of the find)
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", casemate building A, beneath one of the four corners, probably NE
Curator's comments: Bibliography: see also PM IV, p. 7. See also Cairo, EM, JE 27385 & Boston, MFA, 87.528-529, 87.719-20, 87.653.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 54 § 52, p. 54-55 § 54, pl. xxii, 9, xxiii)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.54, p.175, pl.17, p.244, pl.86)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Psamtek I (firom context of the find)
